thread.title: A look at this week's Athens-area high school football games
thread.title_full: A look at this week's Athens-area high school football games

author: Staff
title: A look at this week's Athens-area high school football games
text:
A look at this week's Athens-area high school football games published Friday, October 9, 2015 CEDAR SHOALS AT LOGANVILLE Where: Red Devil Stadium, Loganville Records: Cedar Shoals 1-4, 1-3 in Region 8- , Loganville 5-1, 4-1. Series: Loganville leads 7-6. Need to know: Last week, Cedar Shoals won its first game since 2013. If the Jaguars upset Loganville, it will be the first time they’ve won back-to-back games since a three-game stretch from October to November 2013. Cedar Shoals hasn’t topped Loganville since 2012. 
Records: Madison County 0-5, 0-2 in Region 8-AAAA, Chestatee 0-5, 0-2. Series: Chestatee leads 2-1. Need to know: Chestatee is coming off a 56-0 shutout loss to Buford. Madison County fell 26-11 to White County last week. The 26 points the Red Raiders allowed last week was their lowest since a 17-0 loss to Johnson-Gainesville in the season opener in August. 
NORTH OCONEE AT MONROE AREA When: 7:30 p.m. Records: North Oconee 2-3, 1-1 in Region 8-AAAA, Monroe Area 2-3, 1-1. Series: North Oconee leads 1-0. Need to know: North Oconee was shut out 31-0 by North Hall last week. It was the second time the Titans have been held scoreless this season. They’ve been shut out five times since the program began in 2004, with two of those shutouts coming in their inaugural season. 
Records: Morgan County 3-2, 1-0 in Region 8-AAA, Jefferson 6-0, 2-0. Series: Morgan County leads 11-5-2. Need to know: Jefferson has allowed just 49 points through six games this season. Offensively, they’re scoring 28.5 points per game, down from the 42.2 points the Dragons averaged at this point last season. Morgan County is on a three-game win streak in which they’ve allowed just 21 points. 
JACKSON COUNTY AT ELBERT COUNTY When: 7:30 p.m. Where: The Granite Bowl, Elberton Records: Jackson County 3-3, 0-2 in Region 8-AAA, Elbert County 5-1, 1-1. Series: Elbert County leads 8-1. Need to know: Jackson County has been outscored 53-7 in its last two games against Jefferson and Oconee County. This is the midway point of a tough run through Region 8-AAA during which the Panthers will play all four 2014 playoff teams in quick succession. Jackson County’s only win in the series was a 33-28 victory in 2012. 
EAST JACKSON AT HART COUNTY When: 7:30 p.m. Where: Pete Herndon Stadium, Hartwell Records: East Jackson 1-5, 0-2 in Region 8-AAA, Hart County 3-2, 0-1. Series: Hart County leads 5-0. Need to know: East Jackson has struggled to score in recent weeks, resulting in a shutout loss to Oconee County and a 37-7 loss to Morgan County last week. Hart County has held opponents to 25 points or fewer in four of its five games this season. 
RABUN COUNTY AT OGLETHORPE COUNTY When: 7:30 p.m. Records: Rabun County 5-1, 2-0 in Region 8-AA, Oglethorpe County 0-6, 0-2. Series: Rabun County leads 12-9. Need to know: This the second time in consecutive games that Oglethorpe County will run into a ranked opponent. Union County was eighth (and is now seventh) when the Panthers topped Oglethorpe County 41-6 last week. This week, Rabun County is ranked eighth. ATHENS ACADEMY AT PRINCE AVENUE CHRISTIAN When: 7:30 p.m.
